meanings.definition: To cast (concrete, etc.) in a reusable mold before transporting to the final site.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers precast the concrete panels for the new building.
meanings.sent2: They always precast the beams before assembling them on-site.
meanings.sent3: The precast concrete blocks played a game of hide and seek before being placed in position.
meanings.sent4: Her words were precast in stone, unchangeable and permanent.
meanings.sent5: The precast process made the project move faster and more efficiently.

meanings.definition: A concrete element that has been cast in a reusable mold before being transported to the final site.
meanings.sent1: The precast wall sections were carefully lifted into place by the crane.
meanings.sent2: The precast steps were installed quickly, saving time on the construction.
meanings.sent3: The precast slab joked with the other building materials about its smooth finish.
meanings.sent4: The precast columns stood tall like ancient guardians of the structure.
meanings.sent5: The precast bridge segments fit together perfectly, creating a seamless connection.
